Class Piece

java.lang.Object
Piece
Direct Known Subclasses:
Piece.Bishop, Piece.King, Piece.Knight, Piece.Pawn, Piece.Queen, Piece.Rook
public class Piece extends Object
A single piece, with multiple children that inherit from it and behave different

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    Piece.Bishop
    can move diagnoally in all directions up until there is another piece in the way if the piece is on the other team, it will take that piece
    static class 
    Piece.King
    can move in all directions but only one square
    static class 
    Piece.Knight
    knight: can move in 'L' shapes and can jump over pieces
    static class 
    Piece.Pawn
    can only move forward once at a time, but cannot take pieces directly ahead of it can only take pieces DIAGONALLY, but can only move diagonally when there is a piece there can move forward twice on its first turn
    static class 
    Piece.Queen
    can move diagonally and horizontally across the whole board, until there's a piece in the way
    static class 
    Piece.Rook
    can move up, down, left, right as many times as possible, up until there is another piece in the way if the piece is on the other team, it will take that piece

  • Constructor Details

    • Piece

      public Piece(String pieceName, int pieceNum, int colour, int x, int y, int squareX, int squareY)
      Constructor
      Parameters:
      pieceName - name of the piece (pawn, rook, knight etc)
      pieceNum - piece number for further identification
      colour - piece colour to idenfity what team it is on
      x - piece's x coordinate, used for displaying it in the gamearena
      y - piece's y coordinate, used for displaying it in the gamearena
      squareX - piece's initial square X
      squareY - piece's initial square Y

    • inBounds

      protected boolean inBounds(int x, int y)
      takes an x and y coordinate and determines if they are within the board
      Parameters:
      x -
      y -
      Returns:
      true or false

    • canMoveThere

      protected int canMoveThere(Square[][] board, int destX, int destY)
      identifies if a piece can move to a given square and what will happen if it does
      Parameters:
      board - the board, containing all squares and pieces
      destX - the destination x
      destY - the destination y
      Returns:
      0: cannot move there, 1: can move there, won't take a piece, 2: can move there, will take a piece

    • getMoveSquares

      public int[][] getMoveSquares(Square[][] board)
      returns a 2d array of integers 0-2 that identifies where a piece can move
      Parameters:
      board - the board, containing all squares and pieces
      Returns:
      2d array

    • getSpecialMoves

      public int[][] getSpecialMoves(Square[][] board, int[][] moves)
      for pieces with unique behaviour (pawn, knight) where movement is not linear, this function allows them to behave differently
      Parameters:
      board - the board, containing all squares and pieces
      moves - the 2d array passed from getMoves() that will be returned after modification
      Returns:

    • setCoordinates

      public void setCoordinates(int x, int y, int squareX, int squareY)
      sets a piece's x and y both visually in the game arena, and functionally in the grid
      Parameters:
      x - new gamearena x
      y - new gamearena y
      squareX - new grid x
      squareY - new grid y
